She's someone who's 67 years old...and she's just about starting again," Masaba said. "You should never give up and never say die. I think that's the one thing I've learned from her," Masaba added.

173.title: Let people breathe: Varun on fans' requests to patch up with Divya
173.article_body: Reacting to requests to get back together with Divya Agarwal, VJ Varun Sood on Thursday requested his fans to give him some space. "Let people breathe...Quit the blame game," he wrote on Twitter. Meanwhile, Divya said, "You know what hurts the most? People want to see me somewhere and I don't want to be there...So stop trying."

174.title: Fake ITC racket worth ₹32 crore busted in Maha, businessman held
174.article_body: A fake Input Tax Credit (ITC) racket worth ₹32.5 crore was busted by officers of Bhiwandi Commissionerate of CGST Mumbai Zone. A businessman involved was arrested after it was found that he opened two firms in his name and didn't produce documents on which ITC is claimed and passed on. This is Bhiwandi Commissionerate's seventh arrest in last six months.

175.title: Grimes explains meaning of 'Exa Dark Sideræl', name of her and Elon Musk's 2nd child
175.article_body: Grimes explained the meaning of 'Exa Dark Sideræl', name of her and Tesla CEO Elon Musk's second child. Exa refers to supercomputing term exaFLOPS while Dark is "the unknown". "People fear it but truly it's...absence of photons," she said. Grimes further called Sideræl "a more elven" spelling of sidereal, "the true time of...universe, star time...not our relative earth time".

176.title: Mother of Indian envoy who was found dead in Palestine disputes cause of death
176.article_body: The mother of Indian envoy Mukul Arya, who was found dead in Palestine on March 6, approached the Delhi HC seeking an inquiry into the "suspicious circumstances" of his death, disputing the Centre's claim that he died of natural causes. Court has ordered a fresh autopsy for Arya and said that the same should be videographed.

177.title: OTT content transcends cultures, languages: Arjan Bajwa
177.article_body: Actor Arjan Bajwa has said the OTT platforms are a "complete game changer". "The big advantage of OTT is that you can watch stuff which is spread across languages, continents and cultures," he said. "Just like cinema stayed alongside home videos or satellite television, OTT will sustain. But OTT gives you more of an edge," he added.

178.title: Congress lost by a very small margin in Goa: P Chidambaram
178.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said that the party lost in Goa by a very small margin. "We accept the verdict of the people of Goa. Our candidates fought bravely, despite several obstacles. People have voted BJP to power and we accept that," he further said. BJP has emerged as the single largest party with 20 seats in Goa.

179.title: S Korea's President-elect vows tougher stance against N Korea
179.article_body: South Korean President-elect Yoon Suk-yeol on Thursday said that he will take a tougher stance against North Korean provocations. Yoon also said that he will solidify an alliance with the US and build a powerful military. He also stressed a need to recognise the strategic importance of repairing ties with Japan despite a dispute over wartime history.

180.title: AAP won in Punjab due to impact of farmers' agitation in Delhi: Pawar
180.article_body: While reacting to Aam Aadmi Party crossing the majority mark in Punjab, The Nationalist Congress Party President Sharad Pawar said that most of the farmers were in Delhi during the farmers' agitation and that its impact on the polls was visible. He further said, "Punjab accepted AAP only because of the amenities provided in Delhi."

181.title: Congress unable to convert hard work into votes in UP: Priyanka
181.article_body: As BJP is set to form its government in Uttar Pradesh, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi said the party was unable to "convert our hard work into votes" in the state. Priyanka said, "[Vote] of...people is paramount in a democracy...We'll continue to fulfil the duty of...strong opposition." Congress has won two seats in UP, while BJP won 232 seats so far.

182.title: Man strangles wife to death suspecting infidelity in Bengaluru
182.article_body: A 38-year-old man, suspecting infidelity, allegedly strangled his wife (37) to death in the presence of their eight-year-old daughter in Bengaluru on the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday, according to reports. The accused went into hiding but was caught on Wednesday, with the help of technical intelligence and informants. The accused, identified as Neelakantha, was a cab driver.

183.title: He doesn't have 'damkham' to learn from mistakes: Irani on Rahul
183.article_body: Responding to Rahul Gandhi's "learn from mistakes tweet," Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "I don't think he has the 'damkham' (strength) to learn from his mistakes." She further said, "In Uttar Pradesh, it was said that Priyanka will infuse new life into the party, instead she destroyed it." Irani accused Samajwadi Party of "maligning" the name of the Election Commission.

184.title: Hotel receptionist arrested for raping 20-yr-old woman in Gurugram
184.article_body: A hotel receptionist in Gurugram's Bhondsi was arrested for allegedly raping a 20-year-old multiple times after promising to marry her, police said on Thursday. The woman in her complaint alleged that the accused used to take her to the staff room of the hotel and get physical. She added that she's one-month pregnant, but he has refused to marry her.

185.title: Russian bombardment in Ukraine is barbaric: Polish President
185.article_body: Polish President Andrzej Duda on Thursday said bombing of hospitals and housing estates in Ukraine by the Russian forces is barbaric. "There are pregnant women, there are children... you throw bombs, rockets at housing estates, this is barbarism bearing the features of genocide." President Duda's remarks came a day after Russian forces attacked a maternity hospital in Ukraine's Mariupol.

186.title: UP Deputy CM KP Maurya loses from Sirathu by over 7,000 votes
186.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM and BJP leader Keshav Prasad Maurya lost from the Sirathu Assembly seat on Thursday by 7,337 votes. Samajwadi Party's Dr Pallavi Patel won from the constituency by securing over one lakh votes. Earlier, SP alleged that BJP workers were prohibiting Patel from taking her winning certificate by pelting stones at the counting centre.

187.title: Musk, Grimes secretly welcomed 2nd baby via surrogacy; named her Exa Dark Sideræl
187.article_body: Singer-songwriter Grimes revealed to Vanity Fair that she secretly welcomed a girl with world's richest man and Tesla CEO Elon Musk in December via surrogacy. Grimes, who's also the mother to a son with Musk, shared that the baby's name is Exa Dark Sideræl and they've nicknamed her Y. Their son, who's named X AE A-XII, was born in 2020.

188.title: There should be probe into Russia's conduct in war, says US VP
188.article_body: Speaking on calls for an international war crimes investigation of Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, US Vice President Kamala Harris said, "Absolutely there should be an investigation, and we should all be watching." "I have no question the eyes of...world are on this war and what Russia has done in terms of this aggression and these atrocities," she added.

189.title: Indian Railways resumes providing linen, blankets inside trains
189.article_body: The Indian Railways announced on Thursday that they are resuming the services of providing linen, blankets and curtains inside trains, after nearly two years. In an order issued to general managers of all railway zones, the Railway Board said the supply would resume with immediate effect. The items had been discontinued as a precautionary measure against the COVID-19 pandemic.

190.title: US inflation increases 7.9% YoY in February, biggest rise in 40 years
190.article_body: Retail inflation in the US rose 7.9%, the biggest YoY rise since January 1982, the US Labor Department reported on Thursday. Monthly rise in US inflation has stayed above the 0.6% mark since October 2021, marking a 0.6% increase in both December 2021 and January 2022 and a 0.8% rise in February. Food Price Index marked a 7.9% YoY increase.

191.title: Change is unavoidable if we want success: Shashi Tharoor on results
191.article_body: Congress MP from Thiruvananthapuram Shashi Tharoor commented on Congress' poor performance in five Assembly polls and said, "Change is unavoidable if we need to succeed." "It is time to...reform our organisational leadership in a manner that will...inspire the people," he tweeted. He said all those who believe in Congress are hurt after the results.

192.title: I must have refused around 100 cop films: Ajay Devgn
192.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn in an interview has revealed that he must have refused around 100 cop films. The actor further said that all the cops that he has portrayed have been different from each other. "The cop in 'Gangaajal'...was sober, in control and believed in anti-violence. 'Singham' is Singham....'Rudra'...is a thinking cop with a criminal mind," Ajay said.

193.title: BJP will come back to power in Karnataka in 2023: CM Bommai
193.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that he's confident that BJP will come back to power in the state after the state Assembly elections next year. "We will build a strong and prosperous Karnataka by implementing the good programmes already announced in the recent budget," he said. BJP is set to form the government in four states.

194.title: Final results of Goa election declared, BJP wins 20 of 40 seats
194.article_body: According to the final result released by EC for Goa Assembly polls, BJP won 20 seats while Congress won 11 seats. The Aam Aadmi Party and the Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party won two seats each while the Goa Forward Party won a single seat. The Revolutionary Goans Party also won from one seat while three seats were won by independent candidates.

195.title: BJP's Sunil Kumar Sharma wins from UP's Sahibabad by 2.14 lakh votes
195.article_body: BJP's Sunil Kumar Sharma on Thursday won from the Sahibabad seat in Uttar Pradesh by 2,14,835 votes. His nearest rival was Amarpal Sharma of the Samajwadi Party who received 1,07,759 votes while BSP's Ajit Kumar Pal got 24,021 votes. Notably, BJP has secured the required majority mark of 202 seats in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections.

196.title: 1st time voters have ensured BJP's victory in 4 states: PM Modi
196.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday thanked first-time voters for ensuring BJP's victories in four out of five states that went to polls in February and March. PM Modi added that all exit polls were proven incorrect in Goa and that the party has made history in Uttarakhand by coming to power in the state for the second consecutive term.

197.title: I lost election, not my courage: SP leader Swami Maurya on UP defeat
197.article_body: Ex-UP minister and Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Swami Prasad Maurya conceded his defeat in state Assembly polls, stating that he had lost election but not courage. "I respect people's mandate. I congratulate all winning candidates," he added. Maurya, who lost to BJP's Surendra Kumar Kushwaha by a margin of over 45,000 votes, had left BJP to join SP before polls.

198.title: People were frustrated: AAP's Jeevan Jyot Kaur who defeated Sidhu, Majithia
198.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) candidate Jeevan Jyot Kaur, who defeated Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu and Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) Bikram Singh Majithia from Amritsar East Assembly seat, said that Punjab has overcome identity politics. She added people were "frustrated with other political parties" and felt "looted". She further said AAP isn't here to do politics but "to change the politics".

199.title: BJP is forming govt with 'Jai Shree Ram' on March 10: Aparna Yadav
199.article_body: BJP leader Aparna Yadav, who's the daughter-in-law of Mulayam Singh Yadav, said that UP can't get a better government than BJP. Reflecting on their current lead in the state, she said this is an answer to those who divided the state on basis of appeasement politics and caste, adding, BJP is forming "government with 'Jai Shree Ram' on March 10".

200.title: Belarus President to meet Putin on Friday: Kremlin
200.article_body: Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov on Thursday said Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko and Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet on Friday. Peskov added Lukashenko will pay a working visit to Moscow on Friday and hold talks with President Putin. This comes as Lukashenko reportedly instructed his defence ministry that Belarusian army must prevent any attack on Russians from the rear.

201.title: Our army must prevent attack on Russians from the rear: Belarus Prez
201.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko on Thursday told his defence ministry that Belarusian army must prevent any attack on Russian forces from the rear, reported state news agency BelTA. He added army must prevent any attempt presumably by Ukraine to cut off Russian supply lines. Earlier today, media said that Lukashenko and Russian President Vladimir Putin plan to discuss allied cooperation.

202.title: Final results of Punjab election declared, AAP wins 92 of 117 seats
202.article_body: The Election Commission has declared the final results of the Punjab Assembly elections, with AAP emerging as a winner with 92 of 117 assembly seats. The ruling Congress party managed to gain victory over 18	 seats, while SAD won three seats and BJP two. BSP won one seat and an Independent candidate also secured one seat.

203.title: If B'wood doesn't get stars, it hires people who were once stars: Sudhir
203.article_body: Filmmaker Sudhir Mishra has stated that Bollywood is still star-driven, adding that if they don't get stars, they concoct the idea of a star by hiring people who were once stars. The filmmaker further said that the focus should be on talent, skill and script rather than just the name of the person starring in a film.

204.title: Putin may have Parkinson's disease & uses steroids: Former UK spy chief
204.article_body: The former head of UK's Secret Intelligence Service, or MI6, Sir Richard Dearlove has said that there are speculations that Russian President Vladimir Putin may have Parkinson's disease, which could cause symptoms such as 'loss of restrain'. "And then there's visual evidence he may be on steroids because of the way his appearance has changed," Dearlove added amid Ukraine-Russia war.

205.title: Congress MLAs stage walkout from MP Assembly over cattle deaths
205.article_body: Congress MLAs on Thursday staged a walkout from the Madhya Pradesh state assembly over the issue of cattle deaths. Supporting the demand of BJP MLA Subedar Singh for compensation to the affected families, Congress alleged that the state government was not considering the problems seriously. They also claimed that the state government only used cows for its political benefits.

206.title: A day will come when sun will set on dynastic politics: PM Modi
206.article_body: Addressing BJP workers at the party's headquarters in Delhi on Thursday, PM Narendra Modi said that a day will come when the sun will set on dynastic politics in the country. People indicated this in these state polls as well, he added. BJP is set to form state governments in Manipur, Goa, Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh.

207.title: BJP crosses majority mark, becomes 1st ruling party to return to power in UP in 37 years
207.article_body: BJP has secured required majority mark of 202 seats in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections and will form the government in the state for the second straight time. With this, BJP has become the first ruling party to return to power in Uttar Pradesh in 37 years. Meanwhile, Samajwadi Party has won 75 seats in the Assembly elections so far.

208.title: BJP wins 31 of 60 Manipur seats, set to retain power in the state
208.article_body: BJP on Thursday won 31 out of the total 60 Assembly seats in Manipur, making it clear that it will retain power in the northeastern state. Earlier while thanking the voters, CM N Biren Singh said, "We assure you that this time we would double our effort." He claimed he would urge the Centre to remove AFSPA from Manipur.

209.title: Don't believe one-sided story: Kapil on allegation of not inviting 'The Kashmir...' team
209.article_body: Kapil Sharma has responded to claims that The Kapil Sharma Show makers refused to get the team of Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' on the show as the film doesn't have a "big commercial star". Replying to a Twitter user, Kapil wrote, "This is not the truth...Just a suggestion- never believe in one sided story in today's social media world."

210.title: We'll do better next time: Owaisi as AIMIM fails to secure a seat in UP
210.article_body: After AIMIM failed to secure a seat in Uttar Pradesh, the party's chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "UP public has decided to give power to BJP, I respect [their decision]." He said, "Our efforts were quite a lot, but the results didn't come as per our expectations." "We'll start working again from tomorrow...I believe we'll do better next time," he added.

211.title: Amit Shah expresses gratitude to voters in 4 states for electing BJP
211.article_body: After trends suggested that BJP will form governments in Goa, Manipur, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand, Union Home Minister Amit Shah expressed his gratitude to voters in these states for voting for the BJP. Shah credited PM Narendra Modi's leadership for the poll results. He congratulated BJP workers in these states for the results.

212.title: I was shocked: 72-yr-old Vera Wang on her pic going viral for being 'age-defying'
212.article_body:
America's 72-year-old fashion designer Vera Wang, best known for designing wedding dresses, spoke to BBC about her COVID-19 lockdown picture going viral for being "age-defying". She said, "I was really shocked. I've to be very honest. I didn't think of myself as being particularly 
risqué." She added, "I've been asked - what are my secrets?...One of them is sleep."

213.title: Mika Singh to find wife on reality show 'Swayamvar – Mika Di Vohti'
213.article_body: Singer Mika Singh will be a part of reality television show 'Swayamvar – Mika Di Vohti' in which he will find his life partner. Mika said, "I want my life to be like a duet because life is enjoyable only with your loved ones." Earlier, Rakhi Sawant, Rahul Mahajan and Ratan Rajpoot have been a part of 'Swayamvar'.

214.title: Man kills teen for bumping into him while walking in Maha, held
214.article_body: A 24-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing an 18-year-old pedestrian because he bumped into him while walking on a road in Maharashtra's Thane. The incident reportedly took place in Bhiwandi on Monday as the accused assaulted the teenager with a stone. A passerby found the deceased's body after noticing a foul smell emanating from rubbish heaps in the area.

215.title: Will launch many satellites to monitor US troops' actions against us: North Korea
215.article_body: North Korea has said that it will launch "a lot" of satellites in the coming years to provide real-time information on military actions against it by the US and American allies. It said it will gather information on actions "by the aggression troops of the US imperialism and its vassal forces in South Korea, Japan and the Pacific".

216.title: Lithuania bans pro-Russia events as part of state of emergency
216.article_body: Lithuania has prohibited events deemed pro-Russia, Belarus as part of state of emergency measures, which were imposed following Russian invasion of Ukraine. According to new legislation, which will be in effect till April 20, rallies aimed to spread war propaganda will be banned. Additionally, media outlets can be banned for up to 72 hours if they spread "disinformation", parliament said.

217.title: I don't believe it: Russia's Foreign Minister on possibility of nuclear war
217.article_body: Russia's Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, when asked about whether the conflict in Ukraine would spiral into a nuclear war, said, "I don't want to believe it, and I don't believe it." He said the topic had been mentioned only by the West. He added that the West kept on returning to the topic like Sigmund Freud, the father of psychoanalysis.

218.title: Australia to expand active defence force by around 30% by 2040: Govt
218.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison on Thursday said government will expand country's active defence personnel by around 30% by 2040. Calling it the nation's largest peacetime military buildup, Morrison said the expansion will cost about $28 billion. Meanwhile, Defence Minister Peter Dutton said the move is critical to position Australia as a "credible partner" with the US, UK and NATO.

219.title: Experts will say results of 2022 polls decided fate of 2024 national election: PM Modi
219.article_body: While addressing the people at BJP Headquarters in Delhi after BJP's victory in four state assembly elections, PM Modi said that after the 2019 General Election, some political experts had said that the 2017 poll results had decided the 2019 outcome. "I think they will say that the 2022 poll verdict decided the outcome of 2024 elections," he added.

220.title: Will implement Uniform Civil Code in U'khand: Dhami after results
220.article_body: As the results showed a lead for the BJP in Uttarakhand, Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on Thursday said he will fulfil the promise of implementing the Uniform Civil Code in the state. "We will form a high-level committee of stakeholders after the swearing-in ceremony," he said. "The committee will prepare a draft which we will implement," he added.

221.title: Saina Nehwal crashes out of German Open, loses in 2nd round
221.article_body: Ex-world number one Saina Nehwal crashed out of the 2022 German Open after losing in the women's singles second round on Thursday. Former world champion Ratchanok Intanon defeated the unseeded Indian shuttler 21-10, 21-15 in 31 minutes at Westenergie Sporthalle in Mülheim an der Ruhr. Earlier in the day, 2019 world champion PV Sindhu also lost in the second round.

222.title: Get fishermen held in Indonesia, Seychelles freed: Stalin to MEA
222.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Thursday wrote to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, urging him to intervene with the authorities in Indonesia and Seychelles after a few Indian fishermen were arrested there. "I request your personal intervention...so as to secure the immediate release of the fishermen and their fishing boats," Stalin said.

223.title: BJP workers kept their promise of early Holi from March 10: PM Modi
223.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said BJP workers had said Holi will begin early from March 10 this year and they kept their promise. He was addressing BJP workers at the party's headquarters in Delhi after trends suggested that BJP will form governments in Goa, Manipur, Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand. "It's a 'victory four' by our NDA workers," he added.

224.title: India likely to grow at 7.8% in FY23 with downside risks: CRISIL
224.article_body: Indian economy is likely to grow at 7.8% in FY23, driven by the government's infrastructure spending push and likely increase in private capital expenditure, a CRISIL report said. It added that the Russia-Ukraine war and rising inflation pose a downside risk to the growth. Higher oil prices will widen India's current account deficit to 2.2% in FY23, the report added.

225.title: Feels as great as always: Farhan on life post marriage with Shibani
225.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar, on being asked about how life is after marriage with actress Shibani Dandekar, said that it feels great as always. He further said that he doesn't know if it feels different but the marriage puts an official tag on their relationship. "Our relationship is amazing. It has been since we started dating," Farhan added.

226.title: Man held for raping 6-yr-old multiple times over days in Mumbai
226.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a six-year-old girl multiple times over five days after luring her with chocolate in Mumbai. The accused, said to be the minor's neighbour and known to her family, sexually assaulted her after taking her to his house. Police said the girl’s mother lodged an FIR after she told her about the incident.

227.title: Satellite pics from before & after Russian invasion show power cuts in Ukraine
227.article_body: Satellite pictures of Ukraine captured by NASA on February 3 (before the Russian invasion) and on March 9 (two weeks after the invasion started) have indicated widespread power cuts in the country. Ukraine's Ministry of Defence had on Monday said that Irpin, outside Kyiv, has "reportedly been without heat, water or electricity for several days." Mariupol is also without electricity.

228.title: Germany logs record over 2.6 lakh new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
228.article_body: Germany on Thursday reported 2,62,752 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, logging the highest single-day tally since the pandemic began. As per German public health agency, 259 deaths were recorded in the same period. The surge comes as government has agreed to impose new COVID-19 restrictions to replace the existing ones which are mandated to end on March 19.

229.title: Rare zebra without black stripes spotted in Tanzania; pic goes viral
229.article_body: A rare albino zebra has been spotted in Serengeti National Park in Tanzania. Without the black and white stripes, the foal named Ndasiata is seen roaming around in a field with another zebra in a video shared by the park on Instagram. Faint grey stripes can be spotted on the foal's neck and head.

230.title: Goldman Sachs becomes the first major US bank to exit Russia
230.article_body: Goldman Sachs on Thursday said it was closing its operations in Russia, becoming the first major US bank to exit the country following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Goldman Sachs is winding down its business in Russia in compliance with regulatory and licensing requirements," the bank said. In its annual filing earlier, the bank disclosed a $650-million credit exposure to Russia.

231.title: Poland offers free train tickets to Ukrainians heading to Germany
231.article_body: Poland on Thursday said that it is offering free train tickets to Ukrainians travelling to Germany. Many refugees are camping in Polish train stations, hoping to travel on to other European Union (EU) countries, Polish Deputy Foreign Minister Paweł Szefernaker said. "We are working with our EU partners to facilitate this," he added.

232.title: He is on the right path: Bhagwant Mann's mother on AAP's win in Punjab
232.article_body: After AAP's victory in Punjab, the party's CM candidate Bhagwant Mann's mother Harpal Kaur expressed her happiness. She said, "I'm very happy...His father must have been happy too, to see his son becoming a Chief Minister...Earlier also, he was on the right path [and] today also, he's on the right path." Bhagwant Mann has won from the Dhuri seat.

233.title: Top-order needs to fire up: Mithali on India's 62-run loss vs NZ in WC
233.article_body: India captain Mithali Raj said the team's "top-order needs to fire" in upcoming matches in the ongoing 2022 Women's World Cup following their 62-run defeat against New Zealand. "We need to do better with the bat...it [target] was chaseable but we were losing wickets...keeping the run-rate low enough was tough," she added. It was India's first loss of the tournament.

234.title: Oldest known ancestor of octopuses had 10 limbs: Study
234.article_body: Palaeontologists on Tuesday said the oldest known ancestor of octopuses which lived nearly 330 million years ago had 10 limbs with two of them twice as long as the other eight. Named Syllipsimopodi bideni after US President Joe Biden, the animal was 12 centimetres long and had two parallel rows of suckers up and down each arm.

235.title: Pakistani intruder shot dead by BSF in Punjab's Amritsar
235.article_body: A Pakistani intruder was shot dead by the BSF in Punjab's Amritsar sector, an official statement released on Thursday said. "BSF troops observed some suspicious movement...ahead of border fencing," it said. "Troops challenged the intruder, but he did not stop and continued moving ahead...the troops fired upon the intruder in self-defence," BSF's Punjab Frontier PRO said.

236.title: Results show appeasement politics has no place in country: MP CM
236.article_body: MP Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday said favourable results for BJP in state elections have given a message that politics of appeasement has no place in country. "It reflects the faith and confidence that people reposed in the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi," he said. These polls have also risen above dynastic and caste politics, he added.

237.title: Manipur CM dances with party leaders as trends suggest BJP's win
237.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh was seen dancing with other party leaders at the BJP office in Imphal, a video of which has surfaced. Singh won from the Heingang Assembly seat by defeating Congress' Pangeijam Saratchandra Singh by over 18,000 votes. As per the latest EC data, BJP won 26 seats and took a lead on five Assembly seats.

238.title: Russia is committing war crimes in Ukraine: Slovenian PM
238.article_body: Russia is committing war crimes in Ukraine, Slovenian PM Janez Janša said on Thursday, adding that Russia's military offensive is "against all conventions". Janša's remarks came as Ukrainian authorities claimed on Wednesday that a Russian aircraft bombed a children's hospital in Mariupol, despite declaring a ceasefire for civilians to flee. Russia has called the claim "fake news".

239.title: Mummification in Europe could be older than previously known: Study
239.article_body: Researchers found mummies dating back 8,000 years ago in Portugal's Sado Valley suggesting that mummification in Europe could be older than previously known. During the study of burials, team found an absence of disarticulation in parts of skeleton and an infilling of sediment around bones, both signs of mummification. Mummification is preservation of body after death by deliberately drying flesh.

240.title: Congress candidate Sidhu Moose Wala loses in Punjab election by over 63,000 votes
240.article_body: Singer and Congress candidate Sidhu Moose Wala aka Shubhdeep Singh Sidhu lost to AAP's Vijay Singla from Mansa seat in Punjab Assembly election. He lost by a margin of over 63,000 votes, according to Election Commission. Meanwhile, AAP is forming the government in Punjab after attaining victory in 92 of 117 assembly seats in the state.

241.title: Pic shows dead bodies being buried in mass grave in Ukrainian city
241.article_body: Photos from besieged Ukrainian city Mariupol show corpses being buried in a mass grave site. Authorities have ordered workers to dig 25 metre-long trenches as morgues are at breaking point. Forty bodies were dumped in the trench in the cemetery on Tuesday, followed by 30 more on Wednesday. They were said to be both civilians and soldiers.

242.title: Rawalpindi pitch used in 1st Pakistan-Australia Test rated below average by ICC
242.article_body: The pitch used in the recently-concluded Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi has been rated 'below average' by ICC match referee Ranjan Madugalle. Consequently, the venue has received one demerit point under the ICC Pitch and Outfield Monitoring Process. Madugalle said, "Pitch didn't have a great deal of pace and bounce in it for...seamers nor assisted the spinners as the match progressed."

243.title: Tesla to pay salary for 3 months to Ukrainian employees called to fight Russia
243.article_body: Elon Musk-led Tesla will pay its Ukrainian employees, who are asked to return to Ukraine to defend their country following the Russian invasion, for at least three months, according to a company e-mail seen by CNBC. The e-mail was sent to Tesla employees in Europe, the Middle East and Africa region. Tesla will reassess the situation in three months.

244.title: I did 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' for experience with Bhansali: Alia
244.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that she did the film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' for the experience with filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali. She further said she has wanted to work with him since she was nine years old, adding she was fulfilling that childhood dream. "As a little girl and as an actor, it's the most grateful I've ever felt," Alia said.

245.title: Woman falls between moving train & platform, gets rescued by police
245.article_body: A female passenger fell between a train and a platform while trying to leave a moving train in Maharashtra, the Free Press Journal reported. A video of the incident shows the woman being immediately rescued by Head Constable Anil Upadhyay, who was seen dragging her towards him. The passenger explained that she jumped in 'panic' after boarding the wrong train.

246.title: 8 new police stations set up in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas
246.article_body: Eight new police stations have been formed in the Barrackpore Police Commissionerate area in North 24 Parganas district by the West Bengal government, an official said. He added that while Dakshineswar was formed out of Belghoria and Baranagar police station areas, the Nagerbazar police station was carved out of Dumdum. Naihati saw the formation of Shibdaspur and Halisahar police stations.

247.title: BJP crosses halfway mark, to retain power for 2nd consecutive term in Uttarakhand
247.article_body: BJP will retain power for the second consecutive term in Uttarakhand after the party crossed the halfway mark of 35 seats in the state Assembly election. However, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has lost to Congress candidate Bhuwan Chandra Kapri from the Khatima assembly seat. Congress has currently secured victory in 15 assembly seats and is leading in four.

248.title: CSK share pictures from Rahul Chahar's haldi ceremony
248.article_body: CSK took to Twitter to share pictures from cricketer Rahul Chahar's haldi ceremony. Rahul, who is the cousin brother of CSK's Deepak Chahar, got married to his longtime girlfriend Ishani on Wednesday. "When Deepak brought out the Yellove in Rahul!" CSK captioned the pictures. Rahul was part of India's T20 World Cup squad.

249.title: Thumping majority seal of people's faith in PM Modi's policies: UP CM Yogi
249.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath tweeted, "Dedicated to good governance, security and nationalism, under PM Narendra Modi's guidance, the historic victory of BJP alliance in UP has been ensured." He added, "This thumping majority is a seal of unwavering faith of the common people on the policies of the PM."  BJP alliance won 135 seats and is leading on 137 seats.

250.title: Cong needs self-introspection: Party MP on Assembly poll results
250.article_body: Reacting to Assembly poll results in five states, Congress Lok Sabha MP Benny Behanan said that party needs to introspect on its performance. "Congress must now learn from...failure of this election [and]...unification of anti-BJP votes in all states...should be led by Congress," he added. Congress will face challenges if it doesn't prepare itself to act on reality, Behanan further said.

251.title: Will go with Kumble-Harbhajan over Ashwin-Jadeja: Karim on spin-pairing
251.article_body: Asked to choose between spin-bowling pair of Anil Kumble-Harbhajan Singh and Ravichandran Ashwin-Ravindra Jadeja, Saba Karim said he will choose the former. "I feel that era was more challenging. In today's era...cricket is evolving but the standard of batting has fallen against spin," he added. Kumble-Harbhajan scalped 501 wickets in 54 Tests, while Ashwin-Jadeja have 424 wickets in 42 Tests.

252.title: Pic shows injured pregnant woman being rescued after Russian strike hit hospital
252.article_body: An image shows an injured pregnant woman being rescued from the rubble after a Russian strike on a Ukrainian maternity hospital. The attack in Mariupol, which is reported to have left at least 17 people wounded, has been branded an "atrocity" by President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Three people, including a child, were killed in the attack, reported local media citing officials.

253.title: Proud to be Bhagyashree's daughter, but here to make my name: Avantika
253.article_body: Actress Avantika Dassani in an interview has said that she is proud to be actress Bhagyashree's daughter but she is here to make her own name and identity with her work. "I am not going to say there is no pressure. I want to do it exactly the way my mother or brother (actor Abhimanyu Dassani) did it," Avantika added.

254.title: SP's Akhilesh Yadav wins his 1st Assembly election from Karhal
254.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief and former Uttar Pradesh CM Akhilesh Yadav won his first Assembly election from Karhal constituency on Thursday by over 67,000 votes, EC's data shows. His closest rival was BJP's SP Singh Baghel. To note, Karhal has voted for SP since 1993, except in 2002 when BJP managed to win from there. SP has won 29 Assembly seats.

255.title: Kapil Sharma congratulates Bhagwant, says, 'You won heart of Punjab'
255.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma on Thursday congratulated Bhagwant Mann for AAP's victory in Punjab and wrote, "You not only won the elections but also the heart of Punjab." Sharma shared an image from his wedding featuring Mann on Instagram. "I pray to God that under your leadership Punjab will progress and achieve new heights," he wrote.

256.title: What was the biggest and lowest margin of victory in Punjab Assembly polls?
256.article_body: AAP's Aman Arora recorded biggest margin of victory in Punjab Assembly elections, winning Sunam constituency by a margin of 75,277 votes against Congress' Jaswinder Singh Dhiman. The lowest margin was recorded by AAP's Raman Arora, who won Jalandhar Central by 247 votes against Congress' Rajinder Beri. The second-lowest margin (466) was recorded by Congress' Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa.

257.title: 'Punjab waalo tussi kamaal kar ditta': Kejriwal on AAP's win
257.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday thanked voters of Punjab for delivering his party a win in the ongoing Assembly elections and said, "Punjab waalo tussi kamaal kar ditta." "Sukhbir Singh Badal lost, Captain Sahab lost, Channi Sahab lost, Parkash Singh Badal lost, Navjot Singh Sidhu lost, Bikram Singh Majithia lost. Punjab has done amazing," he further added.

258.title: People have put their stamp on Yogi ji's corruption free governance: Shah
258.article_body: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah on Thursday expressed his "heartfelt gratitude to the people of Uttar Pradesh," after trends showed BJP's victory in UP Assembly elections. Shah said, "People have put their stamp on UP CM Yogi Adityanath ji's fear and corruption-free good governance." Notably, BJP has won 103 seats and leading in 149 seats in UP.

259.title: We aren't politicians, BJP's win in UP is no loss for us: Tikait
259.article_body: As trends showed BJP's win in Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections, Bharatiya Kisan Union leader Rakesh Tikait on Thursday said that BJP's victory in UP is not a loss of the BKU. Tikait said, "We are revolutionaries, activists. We are not politicians, so this is no win or loss for us." Notably, BJP has so far won 103 seats in UP.

260.title: Researchers suggest saffron was 1st domesticated in Bronze Age Greece
260.article_body: Researchers said artworks, genetics both pointed out that saffron or Crocus sativus, world's costliest spice, was first domesticated in Bronze Age Greece, around 1700 BC or earlier. Team revealed that artworks from ancient Greece's Minoan civilisation were likely the oldest to depict use of domesticated saffron. Scientists also found flowers with similar traits depicted on ceramics and cloth.

261.title: BBMP to float fresh tender to complete Ejipura flyover
261.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will float a fresh tender to complete the pending civil work for the construction of a flyover between Ejipura and Kendriya Sadan junction in Bengaluru's Koramangala. The development comes after the Karnataka government terminated the contract awarded to Simplex Infrastructures Limited. The firm had missed multiple project deadlines despite warnings.

262.title: Man stabs driver to death in Pune after suspecting affair with wife
262.article_body: A driver working at a bungalow in Maharashtra's Pune was allegedly stabbed to death by the caretaker of the same property. According to reports, the accused suspected the victim of having an illicit relationship with his wife and killed him after inviting him to an open plot for drinks. The accused was traced through technical intelligence and informants, police said.

263.title: Ukrainians defuse Russian bomb with bare hands & a water bottle, video viral
263.article_body: A video showing two specialists from Ukraine's State Emergency Service defusing an unexploded Russian bomb has gone viral online. In it, the two men are seen disarming the bomb with their bare hands and just a bottle of water. Middle East Institute programs director Charles Lister shared the clip saying the bomb was powerful enough to "flatten a building".

264.title: Russia bans sale of foreign currency cash to citizens for 6 months
264.article_body: Russia has banned foreign currency sales for six months until September 9, 2022, amid the falling value of the ruble against the US dollar. Banks and brokers are banned from selling US dollars, euros and other foreign currency in exchange for rubles. Additionally, Russians with existing foreign currency accounts are allowed to withdraw up to $10,000 in US dollars only.

265.title: 3 workers die after falling in septic tank in Mumbai's Kandivali
265.article_body: Three workers died due to suffocation on Thursday afternoon after they fell into a septic tank while cleaning it in Mumbai's Kandivali, police said. The incident took place after they entered a public toilet's septic tank in Ekta Nagar. Fire brigade and police officials rescued the workers, but all three were declared dead before being admitted to the hospital.

266.title: Pune's Nal Stop flyover to open for vehicular traffic from March 13
266.article_body: The double-storey flyover at Nal Stop on Pune’s Karve road will be operational from Sunday onwards, Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) Mayor Murlidhar Mohol has confirmed. “At Nal Stop, 35,000 to 40,000 vehicles pass every hour during peak hours, so it’s important to have a flyover on this stretch,” Mohol added. The flyover was jointly executed by PMC and Maha Metro.

267.title: EU should show Ukraine 'open door' on membership, says Latvia's PM
267.article_body: Latvian Prime Minister Krisjanis Karins on Thursday said that the European Union needs to show Ukraine a "clear and open door" on EU membership. Earlier this month, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy had signed an application for Ukraine to join the EU. Karins called for sanctions to be imposed on the Russian energy sector.

268.title: Cybercafe owner refuses to work despite payment, beats up doctor
268.article_body: A doctor in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, who went to a cybercafe for online passport applications, was beaten up by its owner on Wednesday. The victim said he was asked to pay ₹1,800 for each application but despite confirming the order, the owner continued others' work. He added he was thrashed after asking for his work to be done first.

269.title: Disney censors 'overtly gay affection' in Pixar films, claims letter by employees
269.article_body: Pixar employees penned a letter claiming Disney leaders censor same-sex love onscreen and cut "nearly every moment of overtly gay affection". Obtained by Variety, the letter is part of a wider reaction to memo sent to Disney employees by CEO Bob Chapek regarding response to Florida's 'Don't Say Gay' bill. Employees said they are being barred from creating LGBTQIA+ content.

270.title: UP CM & other BJP leaders play Holi at party office in Lucknow
270.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and other BJP leaders like Swatantra Dev Singh played Holi at the party's office in Lucknow after trends suggested BJP's win in UP. Adityanath was welcomed by cheering BJP workers at the office. As per the latest EC trends, BJP won 64 seats and took a lead on 187 seats.

271.title: I am thankful to the people: Yogi as trends suggest BJP's win in UP
271.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM and BJP leader Yogi Adityanath today thanked the people of the state as trends suggested BJP's win in the UP Assembly elections. CM Yogi said, "Everyone had their eyes on UP, given...vastness of the state...I'm thankful to the people for making us win." Notably, Yogi won the Gorakhpur Urban seat by a margin of over 50,000 votes.

272.title: Hyd Police to provide pre-recruitment training (PRT) to youth
272.article_body: Hyderabad Police is to provide pre-recruitment training (PRT) to youth, both males and females, to help aspiring candidates secure a job in the force. Hyderabad Police Commissioner C V Anand's official Twitter handle announced that to motivate them HCP will provide all-around assistance by imparting PRT. It covers accommodation, classroom sessions, study material, physical training and mock tests.

273.title: BJP's Pankaj Singh, son of Rajnath Singh, wins Noida seat by 1.81 lakh votes
273.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh's son, BJP's Pankaj Singh won the Noida seat in UP Assembly elections by a margin of 1,81,513 votes. Pankaj Singh received 2,44,319 votes, while SP's Sunil Choudhary received 62,806 votes, followed by BSP's Kripa Ram Sharma, who got 16,292 votes. In 2017 Assembly polls, Pankaj had won the Noida seat by a margin of 1,04,016.

274.title: What was the biggest and lowest margin of victory in Goa Assembly polls?
274.article_body: BJP's Deviya Vishwajit Rane recorded biggest margin of victory in Goa Assembly elections, winning Poriem constituency by a margin of 13,943 votes against AAP's Vishwajit K Rane. The lowest margin was recorded by Revolutionary Goans Party's Viresh Borkar, who won St Andre seat by 76 votes against BJP's Francisco Silveira. The second-lowest margin (77) was recorded by BJP's Ravi Naik.

275.title: Colgate-Palmolive India names Prabha Narasimhan as MD and CEO
275.article_body: Colgate-Palmolive (India) on Thursday announced it has appointed Prabha Narasimhan, former Executive Director of Hindustan Unilever, as its new CEO and Managing Director (MD). Ram Raghavan, the MD and CEO of Colgate-Palmolive (India), has been promoted to President of enterprise oral care for Colgate-Palmolive. Raghavan will be based out of Colgate-Palmolive headquarters at New York, it added.

276.title: Court rejects Kangana's plea to transfer defamation case by Javed
276.article_body: A Mumbai sessions court on Wednesday rejected actress Kangana Ranaut's plea seeking transfer of the defamation case filed against her by lyricist Javed Akhtar from the magistrate's court in Andheri. The court also refused to transfer her counter-complaint against Javed filed in Andheri court elsewhere. Kangana had claimed that the magistrate's court showed "bias and prejudice towards her".

277.title: Putin wouldn't refuse meeting with Ukraine's Prez: Foreign Minister
277.article_body: Russia's President Vladimir Putin would not refuse a meeting with his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy to discuss "specific" issues, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Thursday. Notably, Lavrov made the comment after his meeting with Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba. Russian and Ukrainian officials held three rounds of talks before the talks between Lavrov and Kuleba.

278.title: Political front of farmers' unions fails to win single seat in Punjab
278.article_body: The Sanyukt Samaj Morcha (SSM), a political front of 22 farmers' unions, failed to win a single seat in Punjab polls despite fielding candidates in all 117 seats. The unions had protested against the now-repealed three farm laws. An SSM official blamed fragile unity among farmers and power struggle for the result. AAP is set to form government in Punjab.

279.title: Marriott pauses new hotel openings, investment in Russia
279.article_body: Hotel chain Marriott on Thursday said it has paused opening of new hotels and all future hotel development and investment in Russia owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. Marriott will also close its corporate office in Russia. "Our hotels in Russia are owned by third parties and we continue to evaluate the ability for [them] to remain open," the company said.

280.title: Srikanth wins, Sindhu loses in 2nd round at German Open
280.article_body: Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu was defeated in the second round of women's singles at the 2022 German Open on Thursday. The seventh seed lost to unseeded Zhang Yi Man of China 14-21, 21-15, 14-21 in 55 minutes at Westenergie Sporthalle. Earlier, India's Kidambi Srikanth beat China's Lu Guang Zu 21-16, 21-23, 21-18 to enter the men's singles quarter-finals.

281.title: Mumbai police seize fake diabetes test strips worth ₹5 lakh, one held
281.article_body: The Crime Branch control unit of the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Mumbai Police has arrested a man for selling fake diabetes test strips and seized around 669 boxes worth ₹5.02 lakhs. The accused was caught "red-handed with possession of the counterfeit diabetics checking strips 'One Touch' product of Lifescan Scotland limited," a police officer said.

282.title: B'luru men threaten loan borrowers to post morphed pics online; held
282.article_body: Police have arrested two men, who ran a call centre in Bengaluru and offered loans through apps, for allegedly harassing people over loan repayments. The accused threatened people to post their morphed pictures on social media if they didn't repay the loan, the police said. They were operating the loan apps under the supervision of a Chinese national.

283.title: Which CMs and former CMs have lost their seats in the assembly elections?
283.article_body: As counting of votes for five state assembly elections is underway, Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi lost from two seats and Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami lost from his Khatima seat. Meanwhile, former Uttarakhand CM Harish Singh Rawat and former Goa CM Churchill Alemao also lost from their seats. Former Punjab CMs Parkash Singh Badal and Amarinder Singh also lost.

284.title: BJP spreading rumours by celebrating, we'll form govt in UP: SP leader
284.article_body: Amid counting of votes in UP Assembly polls, Samajwadi Party (SP) state president Naresh Uttam Patel said BJP is "spreading rumours" by celebrating, adding that SP will form government in UP. "SP workers shouldn't be disheartened and remain...at counting centres," he added. The BJP has won 50 seats in UP and is leading in 200 seats, according to latest trends.

285.title: Sweden vows to raise military spending amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
285.article_body: The Swedish government on Thursday said that it'll raise Sweden's defence spending to 2% of the country's GDP. The security situation in Europe has deteriorated amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, it added. However, Defence Minister Peter Hultqvist said it was too early to say how long it would take to get to 2% and that it depended on several factors.

286.title: Ukraine to create state food reserve for people, armed forces: Govt
286.article_body: Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal on Wednesday said government will create a food reserve big enough to feed people and armed forces amid war with Russia, reported government press service. "The state will redeem grain and other stocks in the volumes of annual consumption...," Shmyhal added. Meanwhile, agriculture analysts said Russian invasion could create food shortages for Ukraine and the world.

287.title: Pakistan logs 639 new COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths in last 24 hours
287.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Thursday said the country reported 639 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 4 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to over 30,000. NCOC added that out of 18,049 active cases, 707 patients were critical. Meanwhile, positivity rate has dropped to 1.76% from 2.07%.

288.title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath wins Gorakhpur Urban in his 1st Assembly election
288.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister and BJP leader Yogi Adityanath on Thursday won the Gorakhpur Urban seat by a margin of over 50,000 votes in his first Assembly election. Adityanath won against Samajwadi Party candidate Subhawati Upendra Dutt Shukla, who got the second-highest votes polled. BJP looks set to retain UP with trends suggesting it'll win around 250 seats.

289.title: My father Feroz Khan introduced pop music to Hindi cinema: Fardeen
289.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan has stated that his father late veteran actor Feroz Khan was the first to introduce pop music to Hindi cinema with his films 'Dharmatma' and 'Qurbani'. "Music is one aspect where he excelled. 'Qurbani' was his first four-track stereo recording which was done in London at the time for that one song 'Aap Jaisa Koi'," Fardeen said.

290.title: Double engine government always standing for people: Scindia
290.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, speaking about the election results, said people have given a historic victory to BJP. He added that under PM Narendra Modi's leadership, it's clear that double engine government is always standing for people, their trust and progress. Scindia added that students were brought back from war-struck Ukraine even in the election environment.

291.title: Kim says 'get your f***ing a** up and work' to women in business; criticised
291.article_body: Businesswoman and socialite Kim Kardashian is being criticised for her remarks in a Variety Magazine interview, where she said, "I have the best advice for the women in business, get your f***ing a** up and work." She added, "It seems like nobody wants to work these days." Several people criticised her, with one tweeting, "Also: be born rich. Really helps."

292.title: Ed Sheeran sings in court to prove he hasn't copied parts of 'Shape of You'
292.article_body: Singer Ed Sheeran sang in London's High Court during a copyright case trial related to his 2017 song 'Shape of You'. He's accused of copying the "Oh I, oh I, oh I" part from Sami Chokri's 2015 single 'Oh Why'. He sang elements of Nina Simone's 'Feeling Good' and Blackstreet's 'No Diggity' to show how the melodies can sound similar.

293.title: He lied, betrayed fans: Kaneria on PCB Chairman Raja over Rawalpindi pitch
293.article_body: Criticising Ramiz Raja for defending Rawalpindi pitch used for drawn Pakistan-Australia first Test, ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria said the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman "has lied and betrayed the fans". Earlier, Raja issued a statement saying although the pitch wasn't a good advertisement for Test cricket, they didn't want to create a pitch that put the match in Australia's lap.

294.title: Chandrayaan-2 spectrometer discovers Argon in Moon's exosphere: ISRO
294.article_body: ISRO on Tuesday said that Chandra's Atmospheric Composition Explorer-2, a mass spectrometer onboard Chandrayaan-2 mission has made the first-of-its-kind observations of global distribution of Argon-40 in the tenuous lunar exosphere. "These observations provide insight on the dynamics of the lunar exospheric species..." ISRO added. Earlier, the gas was found only near Moon's equatorial region.

295.title: U'khand poll results are very surprising for me: Cong's Harish Rawat
295.article_body: Former Uttarakhand CM and Congress leader Harish Rawat on Thursday said Uttarakhand's Assembly election results are "very surprising" for him. "I cannot understand that after such massive inflation, if this was the public's mandate, what is the definition of public welfare and social justice?" Rawat said. Can't understand people saying "BJP zindabad" after this, he added.

296.title: No progress on ceasefire: Ukraine Foreign Min after meeting Russia's Lavrov
296.article_body: Ukraine and Russia made "no progress" towards agreeing on a 24-hour ceasefire after talks in Turkey, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said on Thursday. Kuleba described the meeting with his Russian counterpart Sergey Lavrov as "difficult" and accused him of bringing "traditional narratives" about Ukraine to the table. Kuleba added that "Ukraine hasn't surrendered...and will not surrender".

297.title: Punjab BJP chief Ashwani Sharma wins from Pathankot seat
297.article_body: Punjab BJP chief Ashwani Sharma won from the Pathankot assembly seat on Thursday, defeating Congress candidate and sitting MLA Amit Vij by a margin of 7,759 votes. The Aam Aadmi Party is set to form the government in Punjab after crossing the majority mark. However, BJP is set to retain power in Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh.

298.title: As long as he is fit, nobody can touch him: Gaekwad on Kohli
298.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's 100th Test, ex-India head coach Anshuman Gaekwad said he won't be surprised to see the ex-captain playing 200 Tests, a feat achieved by only Sachin Tendulkar, due to his current fitness. "As long as he [Kohli] is fit, nobody can touch him...he'll...play for the next 10 years," he added. Kohli has scored 8,007 Test runs so far.

299.title: Hyd Police issues lookout notice for man missing for over 2 months
299.article_body: Hyderabad Police has issued a lookout notice for a 44-year-old man who has been missing since December 21, 2021. The notice was shared on the official Twitter handle of SHO Madannapet, D Santosh Kumar, with the man's picture and details. The man, named as Pogula Ravinder Raju in an FIR, had allegedly vanished after being released from jail on bail.

300.title: Deliveroo opens engineering centre in Hyd; its largest tech hub outside UK
300.article_body: Deliveroo, a United Kingdom-based food delivery company, has announced the launch of its India Engineering Centre in Hyderabad. The engineering centre will be Deliveroo's largest technology hub outside the UK, the company's press release stated. The company has also started hiring and it plans to employ more than 150 engineers in India by the end of 2022, the release added.

301.title: Before and after pics show destruction in Ukrainian city
301.article_body: Maxar has released before and after satellite images showing destruction of Ukrainian city Mariupol. Extensive damage is seen to civilian infrastructure, including residential homes, high-rise apartment buildings, supermarkets and shopping centres. The city's deputy mayor, Sergei Orlov, told reporters of several civilian targets hit so far, including a children's and maternity hospital.

302.title: People voted for security, infra: BJP's Rita Bahuguna on UP results
302.article_body: Reacting to BJP's performance in the Uttar Pradesh elections, party MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi on Thursday said the people voted on the issues of security and infrastructure. "Public mood is set for development, this is the win of 'Modi-Yogi' double engine government," she said. "After 30 years, a same party is forming government for the second time," she added.

303.title: PM fulfilled promises made to people: BJP leader on U'khand results
303.article_body: Senior BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Thursday said that the party's performance in Uttarakhand was anticipated, adding that PM Narendra Modi fulfilled the promises he made to the people. He further said that Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami "resolved the issues of the people in the last six months". The latest trends suggest BJP is leading with 47 seats.

304.title: 3 policemen jailed in Gurugram for wrongly framing cybercafe owner
304.article_body: A Gurugram court on Wednesday sentenced a retired police sub-inspector to five years imprisonment and three constables to three years in jail for framing and illegally confining a cybercafe owner in 2009. The accused had raided Hansraj Rathi's premises, accusing him of making fake voter ID cards and booked a false case against him for refusing to pay a bribe.

305.title: I am always criticised no matter if I am in the team or not: Imam
305.article_body: Reacting to criticism received despite being named Player of the Match in the first Test between Pakistan and Australia, batter Imam-ul-Haq said, "I am always criticised...if I am in the team or not." "The management [will] decide whether my runs...are quality or not," added Imam. Imam scored 157, 111* respectively in both innings of the first Test.

306.title: Govt school peon suspended for watching obscene videos at work in MP
306.article_body: A peon working at a government girls' school has been suspended for allegedly watching obscene videos at work and for neglecting his duties in Madhya Pradesh's Indore district, an official said on Wednesday. "His suspension orders were issued under the Civil Services Conduct Rules," District Education Officer (DEO) Manglesh Vyas said.

307.title: Anganwadi workers in Delhi temporarily suspend strike
307.article_body: Anganwadi workers in Delhi have temporarily suspended their strike after the Lieutenant Governor imposed the Essential Services Maintenance Act (ESMA) for six months, Delhi State Anganwadi Workers and Helpers Union (DSAWHU) President Shivani said. DSAWHU has been on strike since January 1. They have demanded an increase in honorarium, respectable working hours and status as government employees.

308.title: Ex-UP minister Swami Prasad Maurya, who joined SP, loses by 32,000 votes
308.article_body: A former minister in Uttar Pradesh cabinet Swami Prasad Maurya, who had joined Akhilesh Yadav's Samajwadi Party just ahead of state polls, lost from Fazilnagar seat by over 32,000 votes, EC data shows. He was defeated by Surendra Kumar Kushwaha of BJP. Notably, this time Maurya chose to not contest from Padrauna, from where he was elected since 2007.

309.title: Surrey sign Sunil Narine for English domestic T20 season
309.article_body: The Surrey County Cricket Club has signed West Indies spinner Sunil Narine for this year's domestic T20 tournament, Vitality Blast, on Wednesday. The Trinidadian is the first overseas player to be signed by the county club for their T20 squad for this year. Narine is likely to join the county club after the completion of his IPL commitments.

310.title: As a batter, you can roll out same Rawalpindi pitch for 2nd Test: Warner
310.article_body: Responding to a query about the pitch expected for the second Test between Pakistan, Australia, David Warner joked he is happy to see the same Rawalpindi pitch used for the first Test as a batter. Both teams aggregated 1,187 runs with Warner scoring 68 runs in the first innings. "I...want a game where you can create 20 chances," added Warner.

311.title: BJP reaches halfway mark in Goa, emerges as single largest party in state
311.article_body: BJP has reached the halfway mark of 20 in Goa, emerging as the single largest party in the state Assembly election. Meanwhile, Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Thursday said that three independent candidates have extended their support to BJP. A party or an alliance needs at least 21 seats to form the government in Goa.

312.title: Who is Jeevan Jyot, AAP candidate who defeated Navjot Sidhu in Amritsar East?
312.article_body: AAP's Jeevan Jyot Kaur, who defeated Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu and Shiromani Akali Dal's Bikram Majithia from Amritsar East seat, is AAP's district president for Amritsar (Urban). She's known as Punjab's 'pad woman' for creating awareness among underprivileged women about ill-effects of plastic sanitary pads. She reportedly tied up with a Swiss-based company to provide women with reusable pads.

313.title: I'm working in best era of cinema, there's acceptance: Vaani
313.article_body: Actress Vaani Kapoor has stated that she feels she is working in the best era of Hindi cinema. The actress added that there is a wide acceptance of subjects that were deemed forbidden for actors to choose. "The fact that the industry has produced...back-to-back progressive films...shows the paradigm shift that the Hindi film industry is going through," Vaani said.

314.title: Bulldozer is a symbol of uprooting mafias: Anurag on UP results
314.article_body: As BJP heads towards a victory in Uttar Pradesh and other state elections, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday said bulldozer has become a symbol of uprooting mafias and criminals. He said the victory in these states wouldn't have been possible without the hard work of party workers. "We'll further implement PM [Narendra] Modi's welfare policies in UP," he added.

315.title: NTPC Vindhyachal to set up carbon capture plant in MP to tackle pollution
315.article_body: The NTPC Vindhyachal power plant in Madhya Pradesh will set up a carbon capture plant to tackle pollution, an official said. As a pilot project, the facility will be set up in Vindhyachal, wherein hydrogen will be mixed with carbon dioxide released from the plant. The methanol which will release as a by-product can be further used, the official added.

316.title: 'Ayyappanum Koshiyum' remake starring John, Arjun Kapoor put on hold
316.article_body: The Hindi remake of Biju Menon and Prithviraj Sukumaran's 'Ayyappanum Koshiyum' starring John Abraham and Arjun Kapoor has been put on hold due to date issues. Filmmaker Jagan Shakti had announced the film in 2021, saying that John will take on the role that was played by Biju in the original film, while Arjun will portray Prithviraj's character Koshi Kurian.

317.title: Ukraine's membership in EU 'will take time': France minister
317.article_body: Ukraine's membership in European Union (EU) "will take time", French European Affairs Minister Clement Beaune said, as EU leaders arrived in France to discuss crisis following Russian invasion of Ukraine. Beaune's comment came even as eight EU countries had sought expedited EU candidate country status for Ukraine. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed an application to join EU last month.

318.title: AAP MLAs reach Kumar Vishwas' home to offer sweets amid poll results
318.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLAs on Thursday went to the residence of poet Kumar Vishwas to offer him sweets after early trends showed the party crossing the majority mark in Punjab. However, the delegation led by MLA Manoj Kumar was reportedly stopped outside Kumar's residence by security personnel. According to ECI, AAP has won 64 seats in Punjab till now.

319.title: SC closes nearly 70 criminal cases against ex-Wipro Chairman Azim Premji
319.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday closed nearly 70 criminal cases filed by India Awake for Transparency, an NGO, against ex-Wipro Chairman Azim Premji and his wife Yasmeen Azim Premji. It filed the cases for breach of trust and corruption during a merger with a firm from the Azim Premji group. The NGO later issued an unconditional apology in the SC.

320.title: Bulldozer of development will continue to work in UP: Piyush Goyal
320.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Thursday said that the "bulldozer" of development will continue to work in Uttar Pradesh. "It shows the popularity of PM Modi across the country. It's the result of PM Modi and CM Yogi's social welfare schemes which were implemented honestly," Goyal added. "We are getting more seats in Goa and Manipur than before," Goyal stated.

321.title: Belarus Prez orders specialists to restore Chernobyl power supply
321.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko has instructed specialists to ensure that power is supplied to Chernobyl nuclear power plant in Ukraine, state news agency Belta reported. This comes after Ukraine warned that there was a danger of a radiation leak at the plant amid power cut. Chernobyl, which was taken over by Russian forces, is situated near Ukraine's border with Belarus.

322.title: Our campaign strategy was insufficient, I accept our defeat in U'khand: Harish Rawat
322.article_body: After trends showed that BJP is winning majority of seats in Uttarakhand Assembly elections, Congress leader and former Uttarakhand Chief Minister Harish Rawat said, "I accept it & take responsibility for the defeat." He added, "Our campaign strategy was insufficient and I accept it as chairman of Campaign Committee." He further said that results were surprising for him.

323.title: Will learn from this: Rahul as trends show Cong's defeat in 5 states
323.article_body: After trends suggested that Congress is losing all five state elections, former party chief Rahul Gandhi on Thursday tweeted, "We will learn from this and keep working for the interests of the people of India." "Humbly accept the people's verdict. Best wishes to those who have won the mandate," he wrote. He also expressed gratitude towards Congress workers and volunteers.

324.title: Stayed at his house to understand him: Boman on playing Farokh Engineer in 83
324.article_body: Actor Boman Irani recalled how he prepared for the role of legendary Indian commentator Farokh Engineer in '83'. He said, "I got a chance to meet Farokh and stay over at his place. We watched the India-Pakistan match together." "That was one of the best times...While staying with him, the idea was to...understand the man, his psyche," he added.

325.title: Had a great time shooting with Katrina; she excels at everything: Dhairya
325.article_body: Speaking about his experience of working with Katrina Kaif in a new soft drink commercial, Dhairya Karwa who starred in 'Gehraiyaan', said he had a great time shooting with her. "She's humble and really sweet," he added. "Inspiring to see someone so driven and hardworking even after all the years of success. She excels at everything she does," he added.

326.title: No truth to it: Shamita on rumours of break up with Raqesh Bapat
326.article_body: Shamita Shetty took to her Instagram Stories and refuted a report claiming that she and actor Raqesh Bapat have decided to separate as "they were clashing on too many things". "We request [you] not to believe in any sort of rumours pertaining to our relationship. There's no truth in this. Love and light to everyone," Shamita wrote.

327.title: Cong on way to becoming regional party: Ex-Union Minister Ashwani Kumar
327.article_body: Former Union Minister Ashwani Kumar, while reacting to the Assembly election result trends in five states, said the relevance of Congress party in future will remain 'negligible'. "In view of political scenarios emerging out in the country, the Congress party will remain a regional party," said Kumar who had quit the party last month.

328.title: YouTube, Google Play store suspend payment-based services in Russia
328.article_body: YouTube and Google Play store are suspending all payment-based services in Russia, including subscriptions, amid growing sanctions on the country. Earlier, Google and YouTube had halted selling online advertising in Russia. "As a follow-up, we're now extending this pause to all our monetization features, including YouTube Premium...for viewers in Russia," YouTube said.

329.title: Done a lot of work on playing spin: NZ's Amelia Kerr after victory
329.article_body: New Zealand Women batter Amelia Kerr praised her team's batting efforts which helped them in registering a win over India by 62 runs at the Women's World Cup match on Thursday. "I have done a lot of work on playing spin this winter, at the moment it seems to be going well,” Kerr said.

330.title: India's first indoor skydiving facility to be launched in Hyderabad
330.article_body: India's first indoor skydiving facility will be launched in Hyderabad in April. The facility, offered by GravityZip, will have certified trainers from Europe and the entire skydiving experience will be 90-minutes, including training, according to a news report. Flyers must be aged more than three years to experience the indoor skydiving, which will be provided inside a vertical cylindrical tunnel.

331.title: Brown sugar worth over ₹1.32 crore seized in Odisha; 3 arrested
331.article_body: Three persons were arrested after the Special Task Force (STF) seized 1.32 kg of brown sugar worth over ₹1.32 crore from their possession in Odisha's Khordha district, police said on Thursday. They also seized ₹1.65 lakh cash and a motorcycle from them. A case under relevant sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act, 1985 has been registered.

332.title: No construction activity in Mumbai between 10 pm-6 am: Police chief
332.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey on Wednesday said construction activities in Mumbai will only be allowed between 6 am and 10 pm to keep the city's noise pollution under control. He said noise levels at the sites must remain under 65 decibels. Display boards indicating timings and decibel levels must be installed at all sites, he added.

333.title: Manipur CM N Biren Singh wins from his home constituency of Heingang
333.article_body: Manipur Chief Minister and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader Nongthombam Biren Singh has won from his home constituency Heingang in the state's East Imphal district. Singh got 78.54% of the total votes polled and defeated Pangeijam Saratchandra Singh of Congress by 18,271 votes. The BJP has so far won 14 seats in Manipur and is leading on 13 others.

334.title: Tamil actress forced to strip at knifepoint in Chennai, 2 men record act on phone camera
334.article_body: Police have arrested two men for barging into the house of a 35-year-old Tamil actress, forcing her to strip at knife-point and recording the act on phone camera in Chennai. After filming the act, the accused escaped with 10 grams of gold jewellery worth ₹55,000. Police identified the accused as Kannadasan and Selvakumar with the help of CCTV footage.

335.title: It was a complete performance vs India, hope we can carry it forward: Devine
335.article_body: New Zealand Women captain Sophie Devine has said that their performance against India in their ODI World Cup match was "complete" and they want to carry it forward to the next game. "We built partnerships throughout...The bowling was outstanding, just didn't give them anything at all," she stated. It was New Zealand's second win from three games in the tournament.

336.title: 5-day Tripura budget session to begin from March 17
336.article_body: The five-day budget session of Tripura assembly will begin on March 17, state Parliamentary Affairs Minister Ratan Lal Nath said on Thursday. Around five to seven bills, including Tripura National University Bill, 2022, will be tabled during the session, he added. Notably, this will be the last budget of the BJP-IPFT government before the state assembly elections next year.

337.title: UK freezes Chelsea's Russian owner Abramovich's assets, blocking the club's sale
337.article_body: The UK has imposed sanctions on Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich, which includes freezing of assets and a prohibition on transactions with UK individuals. This means that he cannot sell Chelsea or invest in the football club. Abramovich is among seven Russians targeted in fresh sanctions. The list includes Rosneft CEO Igor Sechin, an ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

338.title: Not opposed to Pete, Kanye appearing on 'The Kardashians': Kim
338.article_body: Television personality Kim Kardashian has said that she is not opposed to her boyfriend Pete Davidson appearing on her reality show 'The Kardashians'. She added that it's just not what he does but Pete won't tell the cameras to get away. Kim further said that her co-parenting journey with ex-husband Kanye West will be really beautiful for people to see.

339.title: People of Punjab defeated BJP, Congress & gave mandate to AAP: Sharad Pawar
339.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday said that the people of Punjab have defeated the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the Congress and gave a mandate to the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) "There was anger against PM Modi in the hearts of Punjab farmers...BJP will have to wait for 2.5 years in Maharashtra," Pawar added.

340.title: Serious mental illness may increase risk of heart disease in adults: Study
340.article_body: A US-based study that analysed over 6,00,000 adults revealed that people who are diagnosed with serious mental illness like bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder may be at higher risk of developing cardiovascular diseases at young age. The study found that such people die 10-20 years earlier than the general population with the leading cause of death being heart diseases.

341.title: Hyderabad to host 'Wings India' event after 2-yr delay due to COVID
341.article_body: Hyderabad is set to host the biennial 'Wings India 2022' event, deemed as Asia's largest Civil Aviation show, after two years of delay due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The flagship event was reduced to a business event in March 2020 after the virus scare. Minister of Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia is said to have confirmed his participation in the event.

342.title: Financial services firm EbixCash to raise ₹6,000 crore through IPO
342.article_body: EbixCash, the Indian subsidiary of Nasdaq-listed Ebix Inc, has filed the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) for an IPO to raise ₹6,000 crore through a fresh issue of shares. The firm may consider a pre-IPO placement of as much as ₹1,200 crore, the DRHP said. EbixCash has a network of over 6,50,000 physical agent distribution outlets for payment solutions.

343.title: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami loses from Khatima seat
343.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has lost to Congress candidate Bhuwan Chandra Kapri from the Khatima assembly seat in the state election. This comes as BJP is leading in 45 assemblies in the state and has gained victory in three. Meanwhile, Congress is leading in 16 assemblies and has won two seats so far.

344.title: Our economy is experiencing a shock: Russia
344.article_body: As the West imposed sanctions against Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, the country said, "Our economy is experiencing a shock impact now and there are negative consequences, they will be minimised." "This is absolutely unprecedented. The economic war that has started against us has never taken place before. So it is very hard to forecast anything," it added.

345.title: Our national leaders will decide on CM face: Manipur CM N Biren Singh
345.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Thursday said BJP's national leaders will decide on the CM face. "We'll take time to stake a claim to form the government, let the results be out...We'll focus on PM Modi's mantra of inclusive development," Singh added. The BJP won 13 seats and is leading on 13 other seats in the 60-seat Manipur Assembly.

346.title: Gaurakshak Dal member issues threat to UP Cong, RLD leader
346.article_body: A member of the Gaurakshak Dal, a cow vigilante group, released a video in which he allegedly threatened former four-time Congress MLA Pradeep Mathur and RLD's state Vice President Kunwar Narendra Singh. The video was made in connection to the Manoharpura (Mathura) incident where the cow vigilante group alleged that beef was stored at a local resident's house, police said.

347.title: 3 independent candidates are supporting BJP: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
