347.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Thursday said that three independent candidates have extended their support to BJP. Reportedly, these candidates are Dr Chandrakant Shetye, Antonio Vas and Aleixo Reginaldo Lourenco who won from Bicholim, Cortalim and Curtorim constituencies respectively. Sawant added, "I have won with low margins but we [BJP] have won with a majority...20 seats [are] confirmed."

348.title: Why wait years to file complaint?: Shailaja to alleged rape victims of tattoo artist
348.article_body: Commenting on alleged rape cases against a tattoo artist in Kerala's Kochi, state's former Health Minister KK Shailaja said, "Why are you (survivors) waiting years to file a complaint?" She added, "You should report it immediately." At least six women filed sexual assault complaints against the tattoo artist after an 18-year-old girl alleged she was raped in a tattoo studio.

349.title: No two countries run by women would ever go to war: Meta COO on Russia-Ukraine
349.article_body: Sheryl Sandberg, the Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Facebook's parent company Meta, spoke about the Russia-Ukraine war, and said, "No two countries run by women would go to war, ever." She said, "There are 12 countries in this world that are run by women." She added, "Those countries run by women, in the early days of COVID-19, did better."

350.title: Putin took us down as social media is bad for dictators: Meta COO
350.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta's COO Sheryl Sandberg in an interview discussing Russia's decision to block Facebook said, "Social media is bad for dictators. That's why Putin took us down." "The scariest part...is the lack of access. When we go down in Russia people are losing their ability to actually understand what's happening...We need to fight for access," she added.

351.title: No-fly zone over Ukraine would end war faster: Polish envoy
351.article_body: Poland's Ambassador to Ukraine, Bartosz Cichocki, said imposing no-fly zone over Ukraine would save more lives and end war faster. Cichocki's comment comes amid requests by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to NATO to impose no-fly zone, which latter has refused. Notably, Poland's PM has said that any supply of fighter jets to Ukraine must be done jointly by NATO countries.

352.title: Mithali Raj starts a geometry class when she goes out to bat: Veda
352.article_body: Terming Mithali Raj as the "best" non-striker, India Women cricketer Veda Krishnamurthy shared a joke in the dressing room that Mithali starts a "geometry class" for the opposition when she goes out to bat. "Mithali's cover drives are textbook, she pierces the field no matter how many fielders you place," added Veda. "Mithali should come at number three," stated Veda.

353.title: Sensex ends 817 points higher at 55,464 amid Assembly election results
353.article_body: The Sensex ended 817 points higher at 55,464.39 on Thursday amid five state assembly election results. Benchmark indices ended higher for the third consecutive session, with the broader Nifty surging 249 points or 1.53% to settle at 16,594.90. HUL, Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SBI were among top Nifty gainers, whereas Coal India, Tech Mahindra, TCS were the biggest losers.

354.title: Sonu Sood's sister & Congress' Malvika Sood loses from Punjab's Moga
354.article_body: Congress candidate from Punjab's Moga Malvika Sood, who is also the sister of Bollywood actor Sonu Sood, lost to Aam Aadmi Party's Dr Amandeep Kaur Arora on Thursday. Arora won by over 20,000 votes. Trends have been showing an AAP victory in Punjab and the party CM's face Bhagwant Mann earlier said his biggest priority is creating jobs.

355.title: Tiger shares video from when he was 'fat', learnt his 'first-ever skill'
355.article_body: Tiger Shroff took to Instagram and recalled the time when he learnt his "first-ever skill". He shared a video wherein he can be seen performing a wall flip on a beach. "Found an old video of me learning my first-ever skill...Gosh, that sand was impossible to run on back when the struggle was real...especially with my fat ass," Tiger wrote.

356.title: We'll change India's politics: Kejriwal as AAP set to form govt in Punjab
356.article_body: AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal called Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann his "younger brother" and congratulated him for poll win. As AAP looked set to form government in Punjab, Kejriwal said, "People have put a lot of faith in us, we won't break it. We will change this country's politics." The party crossed halfway mark of 59 seats in Punjab.

357.title: BJP leading in 7 out of 8 Lakhimpur Kheri seats in UP Assembly polls
357.article_body: The BJP is leading in seven out of eight seats in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri in the Assembly elections. The Samajwadi Party is leading in Mohammdi constituency. Notably, eight people, including four farmers, were killed during violence that erupted in the district on October 3, 2021. Union Minister Ajay Mishra's son Ashish Mishra is an accused in the case.

358.title: Russia confirms using vacuum bombs that can 'rupture lungs' in Ukraine, says UK
358.article_body:
Russia has confirmed it has used "vacuum bombs" in Ukraine, according to the UK's Ministry of Defence.
The UK MoD said its Russian counterpart said the TOS-1A weapon system had been deployed. The system uses thermobaric rockets, creating incendiary and blast effects, the MoD added. These bombs suck in the air around targets and can rupture their lungs.

359.title: Working early helps you grow faster: Ananya on starting her career at 19
359.article_body: Speaking about starting her career at 19, actress Ananya Panday said that during her initial days, she felt disconnected from her friends as they all were in college and she was on the sets working. "No textbook in this world...can educate enough like your workplace," she added. Ananya also believes that working early does help you to grow up faster.

360.title: Over 12,000 Russian soldiers killed, 335 enemy tanks destroyed: Ukraine
360.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Ministry on Thursday claimed that over 12,000 Russian soldiers have been killed since the Russian invasion began on February 24. The ministry added that its military has destroyed 335 Russian tanks and over 125 aircraft, including 81 helicopters. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 1,105 armoured vehicles,123 artillery systems, 526 vehicles and seven unmanned aerial vehicles.

361.title: Nothing can come in front of bulldozer, it can finish everything: Hema Malini
361.article_body: BJP MP Hema Malini on Thursday said that nothing can come in front of a "bulldozer" as it can finish everything within a minute, be it a cycle or anything else. "We already knew our government will be formed, we have worked for every developmental aspect which is why the public trust us," Malini added.

362.title: Batting needs to get better: Mithali on India's 62-run loss to NZ in WC
362.article_body: After their 62-run defeat against New Zealand in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup, India Women captain Mithali Raj said their batting needs to get better in the upcoming matches. "It was a [gettable] score, provided the top order managed the run rate properly," she stated. New Zealand posted 260/9 and restricted India to 198/10.

363.title: Sea creatures learned to gallop even before land animals existed: Study
363.article_body: A study has found that fish-like animals pioneered the ability to gallop 472 million years ago, even before the complex form of life emerged onto land. According to the analysis, ancestral sea creatures were capable of moving with some kind of proto-asymmetric gait. But researchers believe many of the modern-day animals may have lost this ability during evolution.

364.title: Work on Bengaluru rail corridor-2 to begin by March 31: Minister
364.article_body: Karnataka's Infrastructure Development and Housing Minister V Somanna has informed the Legislative Council that the state government will expedite work on the Bengaluru suburban rail project. "We have floated tenders...By March 31 we will be issuing a work order for corridor-2," he said. The project aims to link Bengaluru with its satellite townships, suburbs and surrounding rural areas.

365.title: Gurugram's maximum temperature is likely to touch 37°C by March 15
365.article_body: India Meteorological Department on Wednesday predicted the maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 37°C by March 15, adding that the city will witness mainly clear skies. On Tuesday, Gurugram recorded a maximum temperature of 31°C for the first time in 2022. Meanwhile, Gurugram's air quality improved to the "moderate" category on Wednesday, with an AQI reading of 162.

366.title: AAP to form govt in Punjab as party marks its 1st win outside Delhi
366.article_body: AAP has crossed the majority mark of 59 seats in Punjab Assembly election, marking its victory in the state by a big margin. This is the party's first win outside Delhi, with comedian-turned-politician Bhagwant Mann as its CM face. Meanwhile, Congress has won nine seats, SAD one seat and BJP two seats so far.

367.title: BJP leads in Hathras, Congress yet to cross 1,000 votes
367.article_body: BJP was leading in UP's Hathras Assembly seat at the end of the 14th round of counting of votes. The party's candidate Anjula Singh Mahaur bagged over 59,000 votes, well ahead of the rival parties SP (over 16,000 votes), BSP (over 22,000 votes) and Congress. Congress' Kuldeep Kumar Singh was yet to cross the 1,000-vote mark.

368.title: People of Punjab have shown Kejriwal isn't a terrorist: Delhi CM
368.article_body: As early trends showed AAP crossing the majority mark in Punjab, party chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that with these results, people have shown that "Kejriwal is not a terrorist but a real 'Desh Bhakt'". AAP has won 59 seats in Punjab till now, according to ECI. "The results are a massive revolution," he added.

369.title: Tesla hikes China, US prices for Model 3 and Model Y cars
369.article_body: Tesla has hiked the prices of its US Model Y SUVs and Model 3 Long Range sedans by $1,000 each. It has also increased the prices of some China-made Model 3 and Model Y vehicles by $1,582.40, its website revealed. Tesla's Model Y Long Range car's price has reportedly jumped 20% from January 2021.

370.title: Body of missing soldier on leave found in J&K's Budgam after 3 days
370.article_body: The body of a soldier, who had come home on leave and went missing from his village three days ago, has been recovered from Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam on Thursday. Sameer Malla was on leave as his wife had given birth to their second child. Malla had left home to visit a neighbour but didn't return, a family member claimed.

371.title: Will win 20 seats or even 1-2 seats more in Goa: BJP's Devendra Fadnavis
371.article_body: As counting for the 2022 Goa Assembly elections is underway, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said that BJP will win 20 seats or even one-two seats more. "People have shown faith in PM Narendra Modi. Independent candidates are coming with us. Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party (MGP) is also coming with us and taking all together, we will form our government," Fadnavis added.

372.title: No basis to such reports: Akshay on rift with Arshad post Jolly LLB 2
372.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar reacted to the reports of an alleged rift with his 'Bachchhan Paandey' co-star Arshad Warsi, during the release of their film Jolly LL.B 2. Putting the rumours to rest, Akshay said nothing of that sort happened between him and Arshad. He said, "There's no basis to such reports. I...maintain cordial relations with whoever I collaborate with professionally."

373.title: AAP asked Punjab to use 'jhadu' but they took vacuum cleaner: Chadha
373.article_body: As trends show Aam Aadmi Party's victory in Punjab, the party's leader Raghav Chadha said the people of the state had given a decisive mandate. He said the AAP had appealed to the people to use 'jhadu' (broom) in Punjab but they decided to switch on the vacuum cleaner. Punjab proved it likes the Arvind Kejriwal-Bhagwant Mann pair, he added.

374.title: Ashneer's wife criticised staff for amount of coffee, printouts at work: Report
374.article_body: Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain Grover, sacked as BharatPe's Head of Controls over alleged financial irregularities, "threatened a colleague with salary deduction for making printouts at work", Bloomberg reported citing current and former employees. She "criticised people for the amount of coffee consumed". She also questioned the price of a TV or bike intended as gifts for merchant promotion.

375.title: Salman to start shooting for Chiranjeevi's 'Godfather' from March 12: Reports
375.article_body: Salman Khan will start shooting for his cameo in Chiranjeevi's upcoming film 'Godfather' from March 12 at ND Studios in Karjat, reported Pinkvilla. "It's going to be a weeklong schedule with the two superstars as they will be shooting some action and dramatic scenes in the set-up," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. 'Godfather' also stars Nayanthara.

376.title: Have soft spot for Munawar, it's never going to be two-way: Saisha
376.article_body: Designer Saisha Shinde, who is a contestant on reality television show 'Lock Upp', revealed to co-contestant Sara Khan during one of the tasks that she has a soft spot for comedian Munawar Faruqui. "I am just feeling for him...I know that is only going to be one way, it's never going to be two-way," she said.

377.title: Pitches aren't bad, it's the brains that are rotten: Butt on Rawalpindi Test
377.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Salman Butt has criticised the PCB over the pitch used in the Rawalpindi Test between Pakistan and Australia. "Pindi is a result-oriented pitch. In first-class matches, people complain that matches end here in 2.5 days...Pitches aren't bad, it's the brains that are rotten," Butt stated. "It's their weakness in underestimating themselves," he added.

378.title: Unfortunate that Maha CM, Guv don’t trust each other: Bombay HC
378.article_body: The Bombay High Court  said that it was "unfortunate" that CM Uddhav Thackeray and Governor BS Koshyari "did not trust each other". It would be appropriate for the two to sit together and sort out the differences, the bench added. The court made the observations while presiding over two PILs challenging the procedure for selection of Maharashtra Legislative Assembly Speaker.

379.title: Congress concedes defeat in Punjab elections as CM Channi congratulates AAP
379.article_body: Congress conceded defeat in the Punjab Assembly elections, with state CM Charanjit Singh Channi tweeting, "I humbly accept the verdict of the people of Punjab." "Congratulate Aam Aadmi Party and their elected CM Bhagwant Mann Ji for the victory. I hope they will deliver on the expectations of people," he wrote.

380.title: 'Do you know who defeated Punjab CM Channi? A mobile repair shop worker,' says Kejriwal
380.article_body: As trends show AAP's victory by a big margin in Punjab, AAP Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said, "Do you know who defeated Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi? AAP candidate who works in a mobile repair shop." Kejriwal was referring AAP's Bhadaur candidate Labh Singh Ugoke. The CM was also defeated in Chamkaur Sahib by AAP's Charanjit Singh.

381.title: People voted for BJP's welfare works: Joshi on U'khand poll results
381.article_body: Union Minister and BJP's Uttarakhand election in-charge Pralhad Joshi said on Thursday that the people of Uttarakhand had endorsed PM Narendra Modi and CM Pushkar Singh Dhami's welfare policies. "The result was on expected lines. I want to thank the people...for...result," Joshi added. According to the latest trends, BJP is leading in 48 out of 70 Assembly seats in Uttarakhand.

382.title: BJP workers play holi in Lucknow office, say 'UP mein ka ba? UP mein Baba'
382.article_body: As official trends predicted victory for the Bharatiya Janata Party in Uttar Pradesh polls, party workers played holi at the party office in Lucknow. They also raised slogans saying "UP mein ka ba? UP mein Baba". Meanwhile, a kid dressed up as Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, carrying a bulldozer toy, also arrived at the party office in Lucknow.

383.title: Neymar is a clown and should go to fashion week instead: Daniel Riolo
383.article_body: Reacting to PSG being knocked out of the Champions League after a 2-3 defeat on aggregate against Real Madrid, French football pundit Daniel Riolo said Neymar is a "clown" and should go to "fashion week". "Neymar needs to be fired," added Riolo. "In July, there are the world poker championships. That's what he is good for," stated Riolo.

384.title: Noida Authority plans to build recreational park in Sector 94
384.article_body: The Noida Authority has proposed to build a recreational park in Sector 94 on about 20 acres of land. "Once the draft proposal is ready, it will be put before the authority's board in its next meeting scheduled in March-end," a senior official said. "Once approved, the project will be taken ahead," the official added.

385.title: Fought BJP & Cong: BJP's Atanasio Monserrate who defeated Parrikar's son
385.article_body: BJP's Atanasio Monserrate on Thursday defeated late Goa CM Manohar Parrikar's son Utpal Parrikar from the Panaji constituency. He said, "I fought the unofficial candidate of the BJP (Utpal) as well as the Congress." He claimed the BJP cadre hasn't accepted him which is why Utpal got so many votes. "The BJP leadership...didn't manage to do damage control," he added.

386.title: 'EVMs moved for training purposes 2 days before counting? Just asking', tweets Ali Fazal
386.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal has tweeted, "Do din pehle counting ke, EVMs moved for training purposes? #Justasking (EVMs moved for training purposes 2 days before counting? #Justasking)." Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav had accused BJP of "stealing votes" and claimed that EVMs were being shifted in an unauthorised manner. UP's Chief Electoral Officer clarified that the EVMs were marked for training.

387.title: Intel suspends shipments to Russia, Belarus, condemns Ukraine invasion
387.article_body: Intel has suspended all shipments to customers in Russia and Belarus in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Intel condemns the invasion of Ukraine...Our thoughts are with everyone who has been impacted by this war," the firm said. Intel's announcement came after Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov urged it to stop selling its solutions to Russia.

388.title: Amitabh Bachchan corporation abandoned me post my film Tere Mere Sapne: Arshad
388.article_body: Recently at Bachchhan Paandey's press conference, actor Arshad Warsi was asked about his godfather in Bollywood, Arshad said Amitabh Bachchan launched him with 'Tere Mere Sapne' in 1996. "I started my career with ABCL (Amitabh Bachchan Corporation Limited). But...[post my debut film]...they abandoned me," he added. "So I don't know what to call them. Godfather or what," he said.

389.title: Remove 'illegal' ramps built outside houses in Vasant Vihar: Delhi HC
389.article_body: Delhi High Court has directed Delhi Police and SDMC to remove all illegal encroachments, including ramps and guard cabins, from public footpaths in Vasant Vihar. SDMC had reportedly issued about 460 notices to persons who'd constructed concrete ramps outside their houses upon the public footpath. Police is expected to remove all obstacles from a right of way, the court said.

390.title: I'll take oath as Punjab CM in Bhagat Singh's village: Bhagwant Mann
390.article_body: As trends predict poll win for AAP in Punjab, the party's CM candidate Bhagwant Mann said that he'll take the oath of office in freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's ancestral village Khatkar Kalan, instead of at the Raj Bhawan. "No government office will have CM's photos, there'll be pictures of Bhagat Singh and Babasaheb Ambedkar," said Mann, who won from Dhuri.

391.title: Punjab will now run from its villages, borders, cities: AAP's Mann
391.article_body: AAP's Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said Punjab will now be run from its villages, its borders and its cities. After trends showed AAP winning the Punjab polls, Mann said, "Sukhbir (Badal) has lost from Jalalabad...Captain (Amarinder) lost from Patiala....Channi has lost on both the seats. I had given to you in writing that they'll lose."

392.title: Live heart travels from Mysuru to Bengaluru in 2 hours 25 minutes
392.article_body: A live heart was transported from Mysuru's Apollo BGS Hospital to Bengaluru's Narayana Hrudayalaya Hospital covering 176 kilometres in 2 hours 25 minutes after a green corridor was provided by Bengaluru Police. Two ambulances were used in the process - one carrying live heart and the other as a backup. The organ was donated by a 40-year-old brain dead patient.

393.title: Reliance terminates lease of 950 Big Bazaar, Central stores: Future Group
393.article_body: Future Group companies have received notices from Reliance Industries to terminate the lease of nearly 950 stores due to non-payment of rent. Future Retail said it has received notices in respect of 835 large and small format stores, including Big Bazaar and Easyday. Future Lifestyle Fashions has received termination notices for 112 stores, including Central and Brand Factory stores.

394.title: BJP leads in Assam’s Majuli Assembly seat by-election
394.article_body: BJP has taken a massive lead in by-election in Assam's Majuli Assembly seat with candidate Bhuban Gam securing over 45,000 votes out of over 65,000 votes counted so far. He is leading with a margin of over 29,000 votes over Assam Jatiya Parishad's Chittaranjan Basumatary, who has only managed over 16,000 votes so far.

395.title: BJP's win is victory of their election management too: Shiv Sena's Raut
395.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday said BJP's victory in the Assembly elections "is a victory of their election management too". "Congress party has lost badly in these elections. We didn't get the expected results," he added. Talking about AAP leading in the Punjab polls, Raut said, "In Punjab, people got another option and elected AAP."

396.title: It was the worst moment of my life: Zverev on outburst against umpire
396.article_body: Having been put on probation for a year for striking the chair of the umpire with his racket in the Mexican Open, world number three Alexander Zverev said, "It was...the worst moment of my life." "I can guarantee...I will never act this way again in my career," added Zverev. "If that happens again, you should ban me," stated Zverev.

397.title: CM Yogi likely to be made BJP Parliamentary Board member: Reports
397.article_body: As BJP closes in on to register a historic win in the Uttar Pradesh assembly elections, CM Yogi Adityanath is likely to be made a member of the BJP Parliamentary Board, suggest reports. He is likely to be inducted between March 18 to 20 in New Delhi. CM Yogi Adityanath is currently leading in Gorakhpur Urban by over 46,000 votes.

398.title: 2 men accused of sexually assaulting minor girl acquitted in Pune
398.article_body: A Pune court has acquitted two men who were accused of raping a minor girl in 2018. The acquittal was granted due to insufficient evidence against accused and a false statement by a prosecution witness, court order stated. The minor was found to be eight months pregnant in November 2018, after which hospital informed police and a case was filed.

399.title: Protest march held in Turkey against rights abuse in China
399.article_body: A protest march was held in Turkey's Istanbul against the alleged human rights violations in China on the occasion of International Women's Day. Thousands of women protesters marched holding Uyghur flags and raised slogans such as "stop the genocide" and "close the camps" in reference to the alleged persecution of Uyghur Muslims in China's Xinjiang.

400.title: 'One-in-a-million' 5-legged lamb born in UK, pic goes viral
400.article_body: A 'one-in-a-million' lamb has been born in a farm in Northumberland, UK, with an extra leg. The lamb was born in a set of triplets on February 22 or 22/2/22. Five-legged lambs are extremely rare and Heather Hogarty, co-owner of the farm, said it is only the second time she has seen it in her 25 years at Whitehouse Farm.

401.title: Mark Wood's 'solo huddle' pic goes viral after not being included in England team huddle
401.article_body: England pacer Mark Wood's reaction to not being included in England's team huddle during their Test match against West Indies has gone viral. England captain Joe Root called for the huddle after play resumed after a break due to rain. Wood, who was at the opposite side of the ground, made a 'solo huddle' gesture while looking at his teammates.

402.title: Yes: AAP on cricketer Jofra Archer's old 'Sweep?' tweet as trends show its win in Punjab
402.article_body: After trends showed AAP winning the Punjab Assembly polls, the party's official Twitter account quoted an old tweet of England cricketer Jofra Archer and reacted to it. Archer's tweet originally posted on February 20 read, "Sweep?!" Commenting on it, AAP wrote, "YES! #AAPSweepsPunjab." As per the latest trends, AAP is leading in 92 seats in Punjab Assembly polls.

403.title: I'm touched: Chiranjeevi on Indian doctor refusing to leave Ukraine without pets
403.article_body: Telugu actor Chiranjeevi has shared an open letter for the Indian doctor who refused to leave Ukraine amid the Russian invasion without his pet jaguar and panther. The actor wrote, "I'm...touched to learn that your love for jaguars and panthers was inspired by me...Your compassion and love for these wonderful creatures is highly admirable. I pray for your safety."

404.title: Hardik has qualities to become successful captain: GT's Director of Cricket
404.article_body: Gujarat Titans' Director of Cricket Vikram Solanki said Hardik Pandya has all the qualities to become a successful captain. "He has been part of our leadership group...has taken a lot of learnings from other captains like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli...MS Dhoni," he added. Hardik was picked as skipper of Ahmedabad-based franchise for ₹15 crore before IPL mega auction 2022.
